body_html:
@apaszke HYG https://www.diffchecker.com/o1YJsfZo (i hope that is what you want)

and to clarify where is the inconsistency here are the steps i made:

  1. train the model from scratch for 2 epochs, you will get
    exp1_epoch_one_accuracy and exp1_epoch_two_accuracy
  2. train the model from scratch for 1 epochs, you will get
    exp2_epoch_one_accuracy = exp1_epoch_one_accuracy
  3. train the model from weights of exp_2 and train for 1 epochs, you will get
    exp2_epoch_two_accuracy != exp1_epoch_two_accuracy
body_text:
@apaszke HYG https://www.diffchecker.com/o1YJsfZo (i hope that is what you want)
and to clarify where is the inconsistency here are the steps i made:

train the model from scratch for 2 epochs, you will get
exp1_epoch_one_accuracy and exp1_epoch_two_accuracy
train the model from scratch for 1 epochs, you will get
exp2_epoch_one_accuracy = exp1_epoch_one_accuracy
train the model from weights of exp_2 and train for 1 epochs, you will get
exp2_epoch_two_accuracy != exp1_epoch_two_accuracy
body:
@apaszke HYG https://www.diffchecker.com/o1YJsfZo (i hope that is what you want)

and to clarify where is the inconsistency here are the steps i made:
1) train the model **from scratch** for 2 epochs, you will get 
exp1_epoch_one_accuracy and exp1_epoch_two_accuracy
2) train the model **from scratch** for 1 epochs, you will get 
exp2_epoch_one_accuracy = exp1_epoch_one_accuracy
3) train the model **from weights of exp_2** and train for 1 epochs, you will get 
exp2_epoch_two_accuracy != exp1_epoch_two_accuracy
